titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Elizabeth Keegin Colley Photographs of Prospect Park
2007-2009
PR 357
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-03-23T10:39-0400

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Keegin Colley photographs of Prospect Park
did.abstract: The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The images were included in the book Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece, which was written by her husband, David P. Colley. Images include the Long Meadow, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, and other features of the park.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Photographer Elizabeth Keegin Colley and her husband, David P. Colley, often worked together as a photographer/writer team. In the early 2000s, they responded to a request for proposals from the Prospect Park Alliance for a history of the park. With the winning proposal, the Colleys set to work on what would be published as Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece (New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2013). The images in this collection were included, along with many others, in the book.
(For further information, see the Brownstoner's 2013 on-line interview with the Colleys.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The photographs include images of the Long Meadow, Ambergill Falls, the Lake, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, Lullwater Bridge, and Boathouse, as well as some of the park's flora and fauna. The collection includes Elizabeth Colley's captions for her photographs.

The photographs are pigment inkjet on archival paper, printed from digital images. The images are printed on sixteen sheets (two sheets include two images each), measuring about 25" x 17". Some of these photographs can be viewed on Colley's website.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The 18 photographs are arranged in the sequence as presented by the donor/photographer. The sequence number is noted on the reverse of the photograph, and the number ties to a caption provided by the photographer. The list of captions are in a folder kept with the photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright to the photographs is held by the photographer. Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY, 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org, 212-485-9228.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: Gift from the photographer, Elizabeth Keegin Colley, September 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Elizabeth Keegin Colley photographs of Prospect Park, PR 357, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Larry Weimer in March 2018.
